sentence1: In the Skalunda mountain, near the church, there once lived a giant in the early days, who no longer felt comfortable after the church had been built there.
sentence2: He decided that he could no longer stand the ringing of the church bells;

sentence1: He decided that he could no longer stand the ringing of the church bells;
sentence2: so he emigrated and settled down on an island far out in the North Sea.

sentence1: so he emigrated and settled down on an island far out in the North Sea.

sentence2: asked the giant, who by now had grown old and blind, and sat warming himself before a log fire.

sentence1: asked the giant, who by now had grown old and blind, and sat warming himself before a log fire.
sentence2: "We are from Skalunda," said one of the men saved.

sentence1: "We are from Skalunda," said one of the men saved.
sentence2: "Give me your hand, so that I may feel whether there is still warm blood to be found in the Swedish land," said the giant.

sentence1: "Give me your hand, so that I may feel whether there is still warm blood to be found in the Swedish land," said the giant.
sentence2: The man, who feared to shake hands with the giant, drew a red-hot bar of iron from the fire and handed it to him.

sentence1: The man, who feared to shake hands with the giant, drew a red-hot bar of iron from the fire and handed it to him.
sentence2: He seized it firmly, and pressed it so hard that the molten iron ran down between his fingers.

sentence1: He seized it firmly, and pressed it so hard that the molten iron ran down between his fingers.
sentence2: "Yes, there is still warm blood to be found in Sweden," said he.

sentence1: "Yes, there is still warm blood to be found in Sweden," said he.
sentence2: "And tell me," he continued, "is Skalunda mountain still standing?"

sentence1: "And tell me," he continued, "is Skalunda mountain still standing?"
sentence2: "No, the hens have scratched it away," the man answered.

sentence1: "No, the hens have scratched it away," the man answered.
sentence2: "My wife and daughter piled it up in the course of a single Sunday morning.

sentence1: "My wife and daughter piled it up in the course of a single Sunday morning.
sentence2: But surely the Hallenberg and the Hunneberg are still standing, for those I built myself."

sentence1: But surely the Hallenberg and the Hunneberg are still standing, for those I built myself."
sentence2: When the man had confirmed this, the giant wanted to know whether Karin was still living in Stommen.

sentence1: When the man had confirmed this, the giant wanted to know whether Karin was still living in Stommen.
sentence2: And when they told him that she was, he gave them a girdle, and with it the message that Karin was to wear it in remembrance of him.

sentence1: And when they told him that she was, he gave them a girdle, and with it the message that Karin was to wear it in remembrance of him.
sentence2: The men took the girdle and gave it to Karin upon their return home.

sentence1: The men took the girdle and gave it to Karin upon their return home.
sentence2: But before Karin put it on, she clasped it around the oak-tree that grew in the court.
